item.title: There used to be a public bin next to the bus stop on Homesdale Road, noticed it has been removed, 17th July
item.description:
With only one other public bin on the road that overfills quickly as there is a food shop opposite. Can I ask why the one next to the bustop was removed please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Homesdale Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alleyway used as public toilet, 17th July
item.description:
This alleyway has consistently been used as a public toilet, with no CCTV or lighting to prevent people. There is daily rubbish left, and we really need a solution for all the staff that work on either side of the alleyway.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoreditch High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish attracting vermin, 17th July
item.description:
I was walking past this dumped rubbish the other day and there were rats all over it. This huge collection of mixed rubbish has been left here for months. There is now household and food rubbish thrown in and there were rats all over it. As a regular walker past this property I noticed that the vermin problem is getting worse, with handfuls of rats in and on the rubbish at night, It’s disgusting and a real eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blakeney Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
